Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Thus \Thus\, n. [L. thus, better tus, frankincense. See {Thurible}.] The commoner kind of frankincense, or that obtained from the Norway spruce, the long-leaved pine, and other conifers. [1913 Webster] [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Thus \Thus\ ([th]us), adv. [OE. thus, AS. [eth]us; akin to OFries. & OS. thus, D. dus, and E. that; cf. OHG. sus. See {That}.] 1. In this or that manner; on this wise. [1913 Webster]
Thus did Noah; according to all that God commanded him, so did he. --Gen. vi. 22. [1913 Webster]
Thus God the heaven created, thus the earth. --Milton. [1913 Webster]
2. To this degree or extent; so far; so; as, thus wise; thus peaceble; thus bold. --Shak. [1913 Webster]
Thus far extend, thus far thy bounds. --Milton. [1913 Webster] [1913 Webster]

thus n : an aromatic gum resin obtained from various Arabian or East African trees; formerly valued for worship and for embalming and fumigation [syn: {frankincense}, {olibanum}, {gum olibanum}] adv 1: (used to introduce a logical conclusion) from that fact or reason or as a result; "therefore X must be true"; "the eggs were fresh and hence satisfactory"; "we were young and thence optimistic"; "it is late and thus we must go"; "the witness is biased and so cannot be trusted" [syn: {therefore}, {hence}, {thence}] 2: in the way indicated; "hold the brush so"; "set up the pieces thus"; (`thusly' is a nonstandard variant) [syn: {thusly}, {so}]
